DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Laparoscopy Ligation Method Therapy Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the method of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor used as part of the laparoscopic surgical procedure, creating a small incision through which laparoscopic instruments can be used for examination or excision within the abdominal cavity.:The free text field related to therapy recommended

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the method of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor used as part of the laparoscopic surgical procedure, creating a small incision through which laparoscopic instruments can be used for examination or excision within the abdominal cavity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: (lap-a-RAHS-ko-pee) The insertion of a thin, lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen and remove tissue samples.:(lye-GAY-shun) The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.
The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field related to therapy recommended

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Therapies Specify should be used with CD of Therapies for NICDR context.
